text: (Sample shared by a kind stranger @ Koelschip, May 11/17) Pours a hazy reddish colour with no head. Notes of super super juicy peach, dried stone fruit, almost berry like, citrus zestiness, cheese and barnyard funk profile, light oak, firmly sour, with a long fruit finish. Medium bodied, light carbonation. Magical, one of my very favourite Bokkereyder beers and one Im sad to have only had a sample of so far. Hope to cross its path again, when I expect I will boost my rating...

[5/9/17] Bottle at Koelschip in Copenhagen. Amber. Big peach, funk, oak, sour, smooth. 8/3/8/4/17=4
[5/13/17] Bottle at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Red session. Deep amber. Peaches, funk, juicy, sour, oak, manure. Great. 8/3/8/3/17=3.9
Bottle mbcc yellow. Reddish hazy. Peachy dried fruity, barny nose. Intense. Med bodied, good acidity, super fruity tho. Long.

Bottle at MBCC.
Pours red, no head.
Aroma of peaches and fruit.
Taste sour, nice, peach, lovely.

13-MAY-2017, bottle @MBCC Red Session, with Ulkløbben.
Hazy, dark orange with a low off-white head. Citrus-tart. Taste is citrus, peach, funk. Really tart. Nice.
Pours red with almost no head. Aroma has notes of peach and peach Kernel. Really sour taste with notes of peach and wine.

Bottle @ Koelschip, Copenhagen. Light hazy reddish, orange pour with a decent head. Aroma is super juicy stone fruit. Taste is super fruity as well along with some funk, minerals, cheese and some light citrus.
Bottle @MBCC2017, Yellow Session. Cloudy amber, small white head. Funky aroma, fruits and berries. Funky, sourish flavour. Quite some berry-like sweetness too.
Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Bardzo bogaty i intensywny, brettowy profil, z wyraźną, świeżą brzoskwinią i przyjemną, wyraźną kwasowością. Genialny funk.

750ml bottle @ MBCC 2017. Pours reddish with a smooth head. Aroma of tart berries, peach, sourness, funky farmyard and earthiness. Taste is sour, funky and earthy with some peach, tart fruits and farmyard. Finish is aggressively sour, tart and fruity with some juicy peach and farmyard. Great.
Bottle - Bright peach, very fresh. Cloudy reddish gold. Bright peach, light red fruit and a super dry finish. Brilliant.

Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Yellow Session. Leicht trübes dunkel orange goldenes Bier. Geruch nach roten Früchten, Trauben, Holz. Geschmack ist sehr säuerlich fruchtig, Trauben, Holz, klasse.

duft abrikos fersken frugt lidt æble
smag pære fersken æble sur tør citrus lime
Keg at cbc17 yellow... Deep pink.. Thin white lacing.. Funk berries fruit nose.. Ling funk acetic berries

Bottle at MBCC. 
Pours red with a pink head. 
Aroma of peach candy and a little funk. 
Sweet and super smooth, nice tartness.
Sample @ MBC. Wonderful sweet and sour aroma with just a touch of funk. Taste had got some wine notes, a bit of wood, berry seeds and - or course - fruit. Soft mouthfeel.
Tap at MBCC2017, Copenhagen. Colour is cloudy red with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, red berries and sourness. Juicy.

Mbcc, yellow. Bottled. 
Poured raspberry red. Intense berry aroma. 
Tart, funky. Sweet raspberries, slight dryness, stone fruits. Mouthdrying finish.
Bottled red coloured. Sourness fruits acidic barnyard leather. Lingers long on the palate good stuff

0.75l bottle @ Koelchip. Looks superb. Warm pinkish and cloudy red in color with a lovely medium sized just off-white head. Looks flawless. Smells superb also. Sweet sour red berries. Having a hard time tearing these aromas apart. Sourish and tart, red berries. Rasp apples. Yeah, like a really good quality juice. Tastes fantastic as well. Not too much of anything, superb balanced. Cherries and sour apples. Wood and peaches. Warming on a relatively cold park bench outside Kolschip. A lovely first aquaintence from this brewer. 11.05.2017

11.05.2017, 0,75l bottle shared @ Mikkeller & Friends:
Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head, lovely red-orangy color. Aroma is mild sour-ish fruity, ripe apricot juice, fruit stones, tropical punch, grass, sorrel, mild vinegar, oak, old rope, hints of soda powder. Taste is sour-ish dry fruity, soda powder, sour berries, fruit stones, sour apricots, minerals, berry skin, sorrel, citrus acid, oak. Medium bitterness, sour-ish dry fruity mouthfeel. Lovely. Hand over a barrel and nobody gets hurt...
At koelschip, pours orange to red with small head, aroma of peach, brett, stright forward peachy, peach jam, flavor of peach, sour, clean, lemony, medium to full bodied, Great
Bottle at Koelschip. Pours burgundy wiith a shade of yellow throughout with no head. Aroma is peach heavy. Taste is peach sweet, cranberry tart, raspberry tart, highly tart throughout.
Pours orange/red with little carbonation. Aromas of underripe peaches. Incredible peachy taste that ends in a dry and winey finish

Sample @ CBC Boston, 2016. Deep golden pour with a small head. Plenty of stone fruit on the nose. Loads of peach and apricot fruit leather. Vividly fruity. More subtle barnyard accents. Wood and hay. Flavor is moderately sour. A bit of woody funk. Pollen-rubbed peached. Zippy mouthfeel, effortlessly drinkable. Lovely.

Bottle @thatplaceinnoerrebro. 
Pour a deep rusty ruby red with as good as no head. 
Aroma of peaches, stone fruit, slight green apples, slight grape skin, slightly lactic, rhubarb, slight olive and pear. 
Taste it quite sour l, some stone fruit sweetness to it. Really delicious and delicate. This has that "my grandmas garden" to it. 
Medium bodied, with a rather fizzy/lively carb. Great stuff

Pours a light strawbeery hazy colour. Smell is awsome with strong peach and strong Haribo ferskner, red Apple skin, rhubarb and all kinds fruits. Taste is the same fruity, insanely rich and sour peach broth. This is good.

Sample at Ölrepubliken during GBG beer week 2017. Hazy pink golden with thin off white head. Fruity, with sour peach and sour fruit, a little funk and grain. Dry, medium to high sourness, medium carbonation.

From bottle at olrepubliken sour fest. Poured a light red colour. Nose is yet again absolute fantastic. Big big fresh Peach notes, big stone fruit, Peach cobbler, grains, light citrus, Peach juice, taste follow the nose, big juicy peaches, incredible
A: Light hazy light red colour N: Peach, strawberry, raspberry T: Peach! Berrylike again (strawberry, raspberry and hint of blackberry), farm, hay O: Very nice fruity flavours! I like!

Bottle at Mikkeller and Friends. Pours a hazy warm red - no head. Sour and dry with aromas of peach and lemons. Notes of vinegar and hints of vanilla. Medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Dry sour finish.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 Bottle at Koelschip. Hazy raspberry red with no head. Smells like peach, raspberry, vanilla, candy. Super juicy flavour with rhubarb, vanilla, peach, light raspberry, apricot, lemon. Medium body, soft carbonation, mild sweet and medium sour. Fruity finish. Good stuff.

Bottle.
Hazy orange colored with a small white head.
Light acidic aroma of peaches, barnyard and oak.
Light acidic flavor of peaches, oak and barnyard.
Tart finish.

750mL bottle shared with Nelson at Akkurat on 12/1/16.Large, raspberry-gold-flecked white head shows good retention atop a near blood red body that is well-carbonated and shows high clarity.Peach notes of all sorts with skin, juice, acid and a strong lactic and tart, lightly citric Brett character behind it. Funk and mineral are explosive with tart juiciness adding to the intensity. No flaw or alcohol.Big bursts of peach skin and tannin mix with juicy depth and tight, spritzy carbonation as lactic and brett acids collect on the finish. No overabundance of sourness, though plenty puckering. Those peaches are just stupendous and the mouthfeel and attenuation are near perfect as well. Juicy and fruity as all hell but its so deliciously flavorful, I dont even mind that the lambic character takes a slight backseat. Turns out when you blend great lambics with hand-picked top notch fruit, things go well.
75 cl bottle. Pours cloudy amber with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, peachy and citric. Lingering fruity. Citric. Dry, fruity and smooth citric. Mellow fruity and crisp sourish finish.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2017 Bottle @ Koelschip. Pours hazy red with a small white fizzy head. Aromas of peach candy, fucking huge. Peach skin, stones, oaky, barnyard, light vinegar, hay, horseblanket. Taste is tart, peachy, peach skin, hay, horseblanket, vinegar, light lactic, citrus, red apples. Damn.

Note based rating. Hope to improve on it in the future:Bottle @ Akkurat. Hazy pale red pour with a pinkish white head. Intense peach, light beetroot, hints of fecal aroma, dirty brett and plenty of rubber. Very sour and fairly one-sided lemon, peach and raspberry taste. Reminds me alot of an US sour like the ones made by De Garde. This is too sour and too rubbery for me.
Bottle - pours golden orange - nose/taste of peach, funk, wine, oak, funky stonefruits - medium body
